website_summaries.verdict: An affordable mirror that provides a stable, clear view of what's behind you, although cyclists with straight handlebars will probably have a better experience here.
pros: A couple of different-size rubber inserts let you attach it to a variety of handlebar sizes
cons: The rubber inserts, as well as the minimal instructions, can make this mirror difficult to mount
Some quality issues with the lens (breaks easily, adhesive backing fails)

customer_reviews.title: They Changed the mirror.....
customer_reviews.text: I have brought 3 of these and dropped/fallen and broke 2 of them, only to re-buy.....but the last one I brought (7/2018), I discovered, they changed the mirror from a wide angle view (convex) to a magnified/flat one, now I can't see a wider field of vision. Now it takes longer for me to see any detail because the field of vision is reduced. now useless. Will have to find another brand of wide angle bike mirror. Update 8/22/18: Emailed the company and complained, they said they are going back to the convex mirror in Sept. Hope they do.
customer_reviews.author: Review and Decide

customer_reviews.title: Excellent vision but mirror comes loose often
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several of these for my roadbike and it is still the best I've tried. Real glass, great vision, compact, well-built and designed except the attachment of the mirror to the arm is less than desirable. The chicago screw comes loose all the time and within a month the nut came off! Recommend use blue loctite at initial installation or better yet get a small 10mm screw and lock nut. The owners of this company have yet to address this problem that they have known about for years. They should either put blue loctite on before shipment or use a screw and lock nut. The stability and sturdiness would get a 5 if they address this long standing issue.
customer_reviews.author: ospreyman

customer_reviews.title: I really love the mirror but had issues with the handlebar mount ...
customer_reviews.text: I really love the mirror but had issues with the handlebar mount to the point that I broke my mirror trying to tighten it at a traffic light. I have a 3D printer and am always looking for a reason to justify the purchase so when I ordered a new mirror I decided to work up a better, to me, bar mount. If you also dislike the supplied mount and want one that can be tightened with an allen wrench and have a 3D printer I posted an STL for the mount on Thingiverse. Search for "Third Eye Bar End Mirror Mount" or thing:2955028.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mount, but would be better if convex.
customer_reviews.text: The mirror has flat glass. Since it's mounted fairly far from your eyes, it has to be positioned exactly right, and still you have to move our head around to make sure you're seeing everything. I solved the problem with this: Grote 12004-5 3" Round Stick-On Convex Mirror It's the same size, and mounts in a couple of seconds. Now I can see everything of interest without fiddling with the mirror or my head position ! Of course, things are smaller, but you quickly get used to that.
customer_reviews.author: Pete H.

customer_reviews.title: These aren't convex anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I recently ordered one of these to replace mine that got broken in a crash. The new one came with flat glass. More dangerous than it's worth to me, as the aim has to be perfect, and even then, the vibration makes it more dangerous to try and stare into it long enough to see what's coming. I ordered some Grote 3-inch convex stick-on mirrors to add, so I can get the steady wide-angle image back.
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Firestine

customer_reviews.title: Solid mounting - nice mirror
customer_reviews.text: My usual choice of bar-end mirror from Cateye seems to have been discontinued (only seeing them on ebay now). This may become my new favorite. The mirror doesn't seem to be convex to any great degree, but the size and placement give a good view of the road once adjusted. I've installed two of them on drop-style handlebars using the default expanding plug. My one concern is that the angle screw may loosen - but that remains to be seen.
customer_reviews.author: Diyjon

customer_reviews.title: Looks good
customer_reviews.text: Didn't come with the lock nut, but I found one to use. Install is pretty easy. For those wondering, by twisting the mirror, once inside the bar, it turns the screw, tightening the lock nut, thus expanding the rubber grommets to grab the inside of the bar. Mirror also pivots which is nice. Looks great. Would have given 5 stars, but that chubby guy grinning in the mirror makes me uneasy. Don't worry though, every time I've looked into the actual mirror I haven't seen him.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: well - this is about the fifth copy I've owned, so the 4 stars hasn't kept me from reordering. it is a great mirror - easy to mount and easy to adjust while riding. I'd have shaved only a half star if I could because it does have failure modes that I've experienced: mirror adhesive failed, lost mirror pivot screw (3x), broke mirror back (impact)... however these are either easily repairable or partially my fault. why do I keep buying them? they work as I want, swivel out of the way easily and are usually easily repaired... this particular purchase was for the broken mirror back (at the pivot) which I couldn't fix.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works good for the small size (3" / 75 mm mirror). Feels rigid, mounts fast and adjusts easily on the way. Convex lens shape is hardly noticeable. If I were to design the perfect bike mirror, I would use the same mount with an additional link in lateral axis, a rectangular shaped mirror (3.5" x 2.5") with more convex lens and the circumference of the glass should be sealed to avoid corrosion of the aluminum coating under the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Product & Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased two other Third Eye Bar End mirrors in the past. Great product/value. I accidentally broke one and bought a replacement. The mirror lens was distorted slightly and annoying. I wrote customer service. They called me and sent me three (!) replacement lens. One was convex, because she said I might like it. (I did). Very impressed with the responsiveness, friendliness, and follow through.
customer_reviews.author: G F Kirkendall

customer_reviews.title: Mirror Is Too Small
customer_reviews.text: The Product Dimensions for this mirror are listed as: 8 x 5.5 x 1 inches. But the diameter of the mirror itself is under 3 inches. Too small. Virtually useless because it's so hard to see who's behind you unless you are riding in an exact position, and at a precise angle, which I found difficult and dangerous to achieve.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P. McMahon

customer_reviews.title: Horrible mounting system
customer_reviews.text: This mirror's rubber compression mounting system is a complete joke. It is forever working itself loose. The mirror is not stable in the bar end. I gave up on it and replaced it with the Cat Eye mirror which is smaller but MUCH better.
customer_reviews.author: syanmo

customer_reviews.title: Best Mirror EVER !!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mirror. I originally purchased a side mirror from performance bike and it constantly kept creeping out during rides. I drove me nuts trying to ride the bike and make sure I wasn't going to lose the mirror on the next bump. This Third Eye mirror was easy to install, easy to tighten and lock in and most importantly... it doesn't move. Great visibility in the mirror and there's no distortion. Love love love it.
customer_reviews.author: JA12

customer_reviews.title: Good view size, unobtrusive mounting for drop bars
customer_reviews.text: This mirror is the right compromise between enough visibility and being unobtrusive and sleek. I road bike a lot and want to see what's coming up behind me. I mounted it low on the drop bar ends, facing back/down to reduce drag and not have a dorky blob sticking out. One has appearances to maintain! Unlike smaller convex mirrors I have confidence I can see approaching cars even without lights on.
customer_reviews.author: John Lilley

customer_reviews.title: Best mirror I have used
customer_reviews.text: I have these Third Eye mirrors on two road bikes. Getting them fitted in the end of the bar can be a bit challenging, but once inserted and tightened very snugly, they are great. I also had some trouble with the mirror dropping down when hitting a hard bump. I tightened the aluminum screw several times trying to stop the movement until it finally broke. I put in a small steel machine screw and nut, which solved the problem. Once installed correctly, they don’t vibrate and the glass mirror gives an excellent view behind. I have ridden thousands of miles with these mirrors and would feel naked without them.
customer_reviews.author: Kauai Tom

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of having a mirror at the end of my handlebars so I can monitor traffic approaching me from behind. The two issues I have with this one are (1) it was a bit of a struggle to insert it into the end of my handlebar (it was very tight) and (2) the vibration from riding on the street causes the mirror to wiggle and thus requiring readjusting every few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Adjustment screw is poor....mirror is good.
customer_reviews.text: Great mirror but screw is crap. Stripped the screw out in first attempt to tightened mirror. The slot on the screw head is too shallow. I swapped it out for a thumb screw (8-32). Now it works great, and no tools needed to adjust angle of mirror. They need to use a better screw or thumbscrew or even a wing but would work.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Strobel

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand how people ride without a mirror. All this mirror can or will do is to give you a solid hint about what, if anything, is behind you, but that's about all you need. If you buy one, you'll probably need to tighten the aluminum screw that holds the mirror so that a bump doesn't change the angle of the mirror. That aluminum screw is the reason it's not a 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Randall W. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Install with extra effort
customer_reviews.text: The mirror itself is very good. The mounting is poor. The first one that I purchased fell out of the bar end broke after about seven miles on the road because it wouldn't tighten enough without the nuts slipping into the rubber container. On the second one, I added a bigger washer to the rubber end so that rubber would expand without the nut slipping into the rubber retainer. This helped considerably however, I tape the outsidesd of the mount to the end of the handlebar to insure that it will not fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Paquette

customer_reviews.title: Clear rear view!
customer_reviews.text: Love these mirrors. This is the 4th bike (road) I've put them on. Provides a CLEAR view of what's happening behind you. I've owned several over the years and have never had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Chris

customer_reviews.title: Best mirror ever - good company!
customer_reviews.text: I own about 8 of these mirrors on various bikes and love them! A few years ago they mistakenly produced some that had a flat mirror, rather than the normal convex one. I spoke to the company and they will replace for free any of the flat mirrors if you happen to get one of them. One trick for installation... wrap the black rubber grommet (that goes into the handlebar) with a few rubber bands to help grip the inside of your handlebar. That helps it go on nice and tight...
customer_reviews.author: Guy Shuman

customer_reviews.title: You may stop searching... this is the bike mirror you want!
customer_reviews.text: I searched many similar products and read many reviews before deciding to purchase this mirror. I am confident that I made the right choice and I am truly impressed by this product. I've used it for a week or two every day and have experienced no problems or issues. It installed easily, and came with the additional parts my installation for a smaller diameter handlebar required. It remains stable in its mounting and provides a wide angle, clear view of what's behind. It can be easily adjusted on the fly should you choose to change your view. I highly recommend this mirror without reservation. -John-
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great until it breaks and it will break
customer_reviews.text: My second one and for a second time the mirror screws have come loose and fallen out. The mirror works fine but it’s not durable and within one month is rendered useless.
customer_reviews.author: Cary, NC

customer_reviews.title: Best stable mirror with precise clarity to see behind you
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several style mirrors and this one is by far the best. Very stable so the picture you see behind you when needed is clear. I have this mirror installed on all my ebikes and mountain bike. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JFL1020

customer_reviews.title: Great MC mirrors
customer_reviews.text: These fit perfectly on stock 7/8" motorcycle bars. They can be folded inward to save some space if you're in a tight parking spot. Most importantly, they DO NOT RATTLE LIKE CRAZY like the normal "antennae"-style mirrors. This is even more noticeable on a thumper, where at low RPM the stock mirrors would shake so badly they were useless. These vibrate very little throughout the entire RPM range. A must have for thumpers (or any bikes!)
customer_reviews.author: Andrew G.

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Bike Mirror, I Own 2
customer_reviews.text: Bought my second 3rd Eye mirror for my mountain bike, which I now mostly ride on the street, after using one for years on my road bike. They work, don't break, and can be easily folded out of the way when needed. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: The best so far
customer_reviews.text: The best so far. Since it's connected rigidly to the steering bar, it's the first one that isn't shaking when riding. Also, because it sticks to the side, it makes it easy to put my bike in the back of my minivan. I have 19-ers and before my bike wold never fit in the minivan with the mirror up. It would always gets bent and sometimes even broken. This one doesn't stick up, so problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: V. Taras

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: I tried many different types of mirrors and this is my favorite. I have used this one for over 10k miles on my road bike and just purchased another one for my second bike. The key to this mirror performing well is having the rubber inserts tight enough. I use the larger diameter rubber pieces and add some old bicycle inner tube to make an even tighter fit. Then just rotate to tighten. I really tighten both the mirror and the slotted bolt down. Great mirror. Very clear image w/ very little vibration.
customer_reviews.author: scrabble5150

customer_reviews.title: Easy, easy install. Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the reviewer who received no instructions... Mine were clearly on the package -- both in writing and in pictures. Install couldn't have been simpler: (1) Remove handlebar plug (you do need a flathead screwdriver or something to pry it out with). (2) Insert mirror and turn clockwise until tight. Obviously you don't want to turn it too tight; if you do that with anything, stuff can snap and break. After the 30 second install (give or take 10 seconds), I went for a ride. The mirror works well and does not get in the way. A sturdy product for a great price. I've already recommended it to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Coenen

customer_reviews.title: Great product - made in USA.  Would recommend and buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased other more complicated mirrors and the simplicity of the tension adjustment and attachment concerned me with this unit. The larger rubber grommets were the right size for my handlebar and the tension adjustment (to get these to lock onto the inside of the bar) works flawlessly. If I had a gripe it was the flat-head screw that tensions the swivel function of the mirror. I could get it plenty tight, but would have preferred an allen wrench bolt to get more of a positive "snug" on it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works on my road bike drop bars pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I mounted these on my road bike drop bars, and when screwing it down to tighten it up, the square nut on the back side was pushed inside the rubber parts. Basically once the nut was inside of the rubber parts it didn't get any tighter, so I put a washer between the nut and the rubber part and tightened it before putting it in and it did make it tighter and now only bounces around during rough rides. I did have to tighten the alignment screw a bit, maybe a lock washer would help but its not that big of a problem really.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Safety
customer_reviews.text: I have one on each side. Part of my ride is along a road with big logging trucks and part on a forest. I can keep an eye on the trucks and a lookout for bears
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerHolly

customer_reviews.title: This is the third one I bought. The screw gets loose and gets lost.
customer_reviews.text: Very good visibility. A screw fell out and got lost on the second time I used it. I bought another. I had to add a shim of my own to make it fit inside my road bike handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item. Easy to install and provides a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Good item. Easy to install and provides a great rear view. I previously had handlebar mounted mirrors, but they mostly gave me an outstanding view of my arms. The placement of this mirror is perfect with no obstructions. I usually adjust it as I start my ride and it doesn't move while I'm riding, even on some really bumpy roads.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment!!!
customer_reviews.text: Long time user of this mirror. My last one fell off my bike and cracked. Decided to buy a new one. During my first ride I also felt something was wrong with the blurry overly magnified image. Went back home a compared it to the cracked one. Boy what a difference! Decided to ride with my cracked one rather than using this dizzying one. Do not BUY. It's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: valueshopper

customer_reviews.title: the size of the mirror matters.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I use these on our road bikes. They do bounce out of adjustment when you hit larger potholes (but I'm certain most other truly adjustable mirrors do the same). For us, the placement (end of the hooks on a road bar) and the size of the mirror made these the right choice. The mirror isn't huge, but anything smaller would be too small. Good product, great price, helps watch for cars (and when drafting, it gives me a much better idea where she is behind me).
customer_reviews.author: John Arthur Lee (writer, designer, typewriter enthusiast)

customer_reviews.title: Horribly visibility!  (used to be great)
customer_reviews.text: I've have bought this mirror many times in the past. It used to be great. Now they've changed the mirror. It used to be a great visibility convex mirror. Now its flat. I think it might be polished aluminum or something similar. As a result, its useless. Can't see anything in it. Forget Third Eye. MEACHOW makes a similar mirror with excellent visibility.
customer_reviews.author: John Musgrave

customer_reviews.title: Flat mirror, not convex as stated
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these that I have gotten with a flat mirror. All you can see is your elbow. They used to come with convex mirrors and gave a great view of what is behind you. If you can find one in a store that you can check to make sure it has a convex mirror, buy it. Don't order it from Amazon or on eBay. I got ones with flat mirrors from both.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dragich

customer_reviews.title: Loose hinge requires modification to make usable
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this exact mirror 5 years ago and was happy with the purchase as it worked well, however it appears quality control has slipped since then. The hinge for the mirror need more tension, as it is held together with a rivet so there is no way of tightening. The joint is loose enough that the mirror flops out of position as soon as you start riding. I read that another user drilled out the rivet and replaced it with a machine screw, this is what I will probably end up doing to make this useable. Aside from these shortcomings, installation is a breeze and is toolless.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Easy to attach.
customer_reviews.text: Helmet mounted mirrors have become too complicated. This mirror mounts easily. Do not overtighten. Stays put and gives you a nice view of what's happening behind you. I mounted mine on some angled bar end extensions on some touring bars. Cycling without a mirror is nuts. Once you've used one, you'll never want to be without one.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey L

customer_reviews.title: OK but I can't keep it adjusted.  Hits wall when parking bike and moves out of alignment.
customer_reviews.text: Can't keep this adjusted properly. When I park my bike it hits objects and moves. It also does not fit securely inside the end of my handlebars. Maybe it's user error as I don't recall ready the instructions, but I am pretty handy with stuff like this. When I get it repositioned - during every commute - it works fine and is helpful. It does not move around during a ride due to road shock. A little hard to judge distances but seeing anything back there is helpful
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I have tried other mirror that were so distorted and wobbly. This one is perfect in every way.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: Great small mirror. Easy to install. You may need to cut the rubber end of your grip off with a razor first. This mirror doesn't stick out much, which makes it good for tight bike paths.
customer_reviews.author: DRH

customer_reviews.title: Great view, moves slightly
customer_reviews.text: Overall this mirror is great. I use this on my road bike that has drop handlebars. The glass is very clear and I can see both lanes of traffic easily. The only issue I have is that the hinge on the mirror does not appear to be tight enough. Over the course of a mile or two, I find myself readjusting the mirror up again. This is on generally smooth roads - I'm assuming you'd be constantly adjusting it if you were on bumpier terrain or roads.
customer_reviews.author: Al F.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Fits on my bike with no problems. Easy to see what's coming up from behind. Folds in for storage. Won't go without a rearview mirror again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Essential for biking on the road
customer_reviews.text: I had this installed on my bike a few months ago, and it has been great, helping me stay aware of what is behind me without constantly turning around and straining my neck. It doesn't vibrate when I ride, so I can clearly see what is behind me. The convex shape gives a great viewing angle so I not only see things behind me to the left (I installed it on the left handlebar), but I can also see if there is a car coming up behind me when I want to move to the right lane. Overall, I've been extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: J. A. Sperling

customer_reviews.title: First - because it's simply the best functioning mirror I can find
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 4 of these over the past 8 years. Why 4? First - because it's simply the best functioning mirror I can find. Second - the plastic lens will break. The one on my bike right now is cracked, but it still does the job. The design is easy to use. I just wish the actual mirror was more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie A

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but not as useful as hoped
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and a helmet mirror at the same time. This mirror is good quality but just not very useful. That's not the fault of the mirror itself, but of bar end mirrors in general. It's hard to get a good view from it. Also, it protrudes so much that it's sometimes hard to fit my bike into a rack with other bikes; it also gets knocked out of alignment frequently and is hard to reset to a good position. I removed it and use the helmet mirror instead; much better in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: bw

customer_reviews.title: Staying Alive
customer_reviews.text: As I motorcyclist I know a clear view of what's going on behind me is essential for safety. As a bicyclist, a clear view of what's going on behind me is absolutely essential to staying alive - because every vehicle is overtaking me. I use one of these at the end of each handlebar. Installation on my bike was simple: Just cut an "X" in the very end of the hand grip and shove the mirror stub in.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: A Great Bicycle Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I've used these on a couple of mountain bikes so far and have been very pleased with them. The first thing I really like about it is the size and shape of the mirror. It's a comparatively big mirror, compared to most I've seen, and is also slightly convex which means it has a good field of vision. The second thing is the fact that it mounts directly to the side of the handle bar rather than sitting on an arm. It does mean that it sits a bit lower but it is very stable and there's no discernible shaking which makes for easy rear viewing.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Decent mirrors, need better bolts.
customer_reviews.text: I put these in the ends of road bike handlebars. Wider bars would give a better view but they're ok. I had to replace the hardware with bolts from the hardware store, now I can tighten them enough to keep them from moving from bumps.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stable mirror that does not get in the way of your hands.
customer_reviews.text: These attach to the inside of your handlebars and stick straight out of the end. My wife and I ride hybrid bikes with fairly straight handlebars -- not like road bike bars.These mirrors are very stable and the rear view is excellent. I have tried other mirrors that got in the way of my hands on the handlebars, but these are completely out of the way. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JoeInTampa

customer_reviews.title: Great mirrors, great value!
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a pair of these mirrors when I lived in Japan 20 years ago. I eventually broke them in moves from several countries and was delighted to find them again. These are as good as the ones I bought before and I'm happy to have them back on my bike and on my husband's bike. Can't recommend them enough! I've had others over the years that just weren't as good though they were much more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Book Addict

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great, but not any more!
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these for years and it was great, however it broke in a crash. I bought a replacement, it arrived with a key screw missing. I returned that to get another and the plastic cracked and the mirror fell out on my first ride with it. DO NOT BUY. I'm changing brands.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good value and it works !
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool product for the price. Unless you have a very wide diameter handlebar, it will fit. Does it feel solid ? No, but it works and it's a real mirror. If I dumped the bike it probably wouldn't survive but at that price, I would buy it again. It does the job and appears to hold it's position Ok. Value and price are in line.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Rhinesmith

customer_reviews.title: Useful mirror !
customer_reviews.text: Once I got this mirror mounted on my bike it has proved extremely useful for checking traffic and cars behind me although it took a certain amount of elbow grease to get it mounted I don't feel like it will fall off it comes with two size rubbercylinders but it has to fit correctly because tightening it down doesn't exactly make it wider or a tighter fit as one would think
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Rear View
customer_reviews.text: I own three of the Third Eye Bar mirrors. Excellent optical quality gives distortion free rear views, absent vibration due to the excellent damping properties of the rubber mounting inserts. It took me several passes to select the proper insert size for my bar diameter then work through how far to tighten the mirror in the bar to obtain a solid mount. Be certain to reseat the grips then remount the mirror if the grips have a tendency to move off the handle bars.
customer_reviews.author: Longboard G

customer_reviews.title: good mirror
customer_reviews.text: The mirror works well. However, I am having trouble getting it tight in the end of the bike handlebars. I turn the end that is to go into the handlebar, push it in and then turn it further to tighten. I think it is tight but as I ride along vibrations and bumps cause it to move and start coming out. I seem to have to keep an eye on it and keep pushing it back in. I haven't given up yet but not as simple as I would have hoped.
customer_reviews.author: steven g

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror.
customer_reviews.text: Helps me keep an eye on approaching traffic which is important on the roads where I live.
customer_reviews.author: A. Altenbach

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install on my bike. Minutes to install.
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit worried about whether I could install this mirror after reading some of the reviews here. Still, I liked Third Eye's pricing enough to give them a try. An excellent product and I hope to get many years of use from it. One caution, be sure NOT to lose the square nut that goes on the end of the attachment end. Mine was loose in the packaging and could be easily lost.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Tennant

customer_reviews.title: Best bar end mirror on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best bar end mirror on the market. I purchased this to replace one that got broken when a car hit my bike. I'm OK ;-)
customer_reviews.author: James Glenn

customer_reviews.title: This handy little mirror works great. its easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: This handy little mirror works great. its easy to clean, and the only reason i mention the cleaning part is because it does rotate up and down while riding after a little bit and i keep having to rotate it back into place with my sweaty hand. Im sure its an easy fix once i get time to engineer it. otherwise if it stayed solid from the get-go it would get 4-5 stars. id recommend a bigger mirror for those with vision problems
customer_reviews.author: C.Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Product would work better on a different handlebar
customer_reviews.text: Screws into end of handlebar so be sure your handlebar is just right to have a mirror RIGHT ON THE END. Mine wasn't
customer_reviews.author: Sparky

customer_reviews.title: vibrates too much
customer_reviews.text: There are better units out there; vibrates entirely too much, can't see behind you.
customer_reviews.author: C.P.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: bought this as a replacement for another mirror and have to say the second time was a charm--I use my bike to go to and from work and part of that is on a very busy 4 lane street which at one point I need to move over to the left lane and then make a left turn--it is nice to not have to keep turning my head to see if the way is clear--while you dont have a sense of distance with this mirror you can easily see if something is there or not--only down side to it is now I have to order another one as my better half really likes it also
customer_reviews.author: coffeeformom

customer_reviews.title: Blurry, narrow field of view
customer_reviews.text: Blurry and narrow field of view makes it useless. The Myracycle mirror is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Helderberg Complainer

customer_reviews.title: Don't like it...
customer_reviews.text: Mirror is similar to a passenger-side auto mirror, too hard to judge distance of vehicles. If I'm riding on a trail or road that is not super smooth the mirror will wiggle (yes it's tightened), & since the rearward view appears small, I usually have no idea what's behind me until it's too close. I give it a 3 because for now, it's better than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mccrillis

customer_reviews.title: Best
customer_reviews.text: Tried oh so many mirrors & this is the best: stable & clear view. I'm visually impaired & take several seconds to focus. This mirror has been the best I've tried. I have 2 attached to bar ends that are attached to my figure 8 style trekking bars (look like insect antennae) & will place a third one using a bar end on my touring bike drop bars. No vibration, do not come loose, and clear viewing. I recommend this product (especially with the bar ends)
customer_reviews.author: CharlieOldGuy

customer_reviews.title: Saves lives
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect and works as intended, not durable but it's the right price
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great mirror
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these a few years ago and had used it happily but my bike got knocked over and the mirror broke a few weeks back. This is an exact replacement and I put it on and it works perfectly. Very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Grenier

customer_reviews.title: almost
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work well for me on a drop bar road bike. The product quality is fine, it mounts well, stays put and gives a clear and large enough image. A clear image of my thigh. To actually see the road behind me I had to pull my leg as far up and in as possible. If it mounted just a bit further outboard it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Guerra

customer_reviews.title: A little tricky to secure but functions wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to install but once setup it functions wonderfully. It's not too big where it gets in the way. As long as you install it securely it will hold its angle. It's also easy to adjust even while riding. I will often tweak to get a look at my kids in the trailer and can easily tweak back to get a better view of the street behind us. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really need this
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could stay out of the way of other riders. It really busy/crowded where i ride every morning. I really like it as there is no room on my bars for anything. Also I like the glass lens, doesn't scratch but it sure does break when the bike falls over which is why i buy 2 at a time. And the price is right. The range of view covers wide and distance very well versus plastic lens.
customer_reviews.author: S. Zippay

customer_reviews.title: Nice little mirror for straight bar handlebars
customer_reviews.text: Nice little mirror for straight bar handlebars, but for bent down handlebars, no good. The handlebar passed right over the lens, blocking 80% of the view. Knee blocked another 15%, so my experience wasn't good. But a nicely made mirror otherwise for straight bar handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: Nickskeys

customer_reviews.title: Best I've found
customer_reviews.text: Best mirror I've found. Little to no vibration to fuzzy up the view. I will not ride without one. They are glass and will break, went 13 months with current one. Have one on all three of my bikes.
customer_reviews.author: John Knight

customer_reviews.title: These work nice as I do some riding in traffic
customer_reviews.text: These work nice as I do some riding in traffic. I bought 3 so would have spares when if one broke during an accident.
customer_reviews.author: Roy  H.

customer_reviews.title: They work well.
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for several bikes over the years. They are good and work well, but they are glass and will break if you drop the bike or get careless.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley C. Speck

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this mirror -- I'm old, intend to get older, so I don't have to be cool. That said, this mirror is inconspicuous while offering excellent vision to the rear. DON'T try to tighten it in the handlebar by holding on to the mirror -- use a crescent wrench on the bracket behind the mirror. I have this mirror on both of my flat-bar bikes, and I couldn't be happier. Enjoy your ride!
customer_reviews.author: HJA

customer_reviews.title: Good to have
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain in the ass to install. It didn't come with the shimmies and my handlebar was in the zone of being too big AND too small for a proper fit. I don't have any tools so I had to get creative. It took an hour and a half of experimenting to get something to work (I used some weird plasticy plant name stakes as shimmies). It's easy to adjust to where I can see it and has a nice view. It feels like it crowds my hand a little bit I just need to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: kittydorkdork

customer_reviews.title: Love this mirror.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, but high quality. I keep spares of this mirror Incase I damage the one on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Z

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mirror!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviewed and researching more than one mirror I decided to give this one a try. When I received the mirror I tried to slip it into my handle bar but it was to snug. I had a trick that worked perfectly. Some soapy water in the two rubber pieces of the mirror helped it slip right in. I turned the mirror and let it get tight. I waited a couple hours to let the water evaporate and BAM! Perfect fit, nothing moves and it works great! It does not move when you hit bumps and has a large field if view. I recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mirros for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are nice mirrors for the price. I actually bought and used them on a motorcycle and was happy with the performance. On the left side hand grip, which was stationary, the grip installed and has not moved since and provides a clear image. The right side was installed where the throttle must have the ability to rotate. Because of this the mirror must be installed farther out and vibrates creating a blurry image and need for frequent adjustment. This is not what these mirrors were intended for and I believe they would work flawlessly on a bicycle and I am happy with what I received for the price.
customer_reviews.author: jmayz26

customer_reviews.title: Mirror not reflecting clearly.
customer_reviews.text: Once attached I needed to tighten even more in order for the mirror to remain securely in position. The mirror itself does not reflect as accurately as other mirrors I have owned. It takes some getting used to.
customer_reviews.author: LLN

customer_reviews.title: Quality mirror
customer_reviews.text: The mounting system for this mirror is the best I've used. There are two sizes of expanding rubber plugs that seem to fit everything perfectly. Some mirrors use plastic and if the bar size is slightly different they don't fit. The mirror is clear and easy to adjust, there is no vibration. One draw back is the instructions appear to be for a different type of mirror, but instalation is simple and straightforward. Highly recomended
customer_reviews.author: R Man

customer_reviews.title: Don't let the freaky guy in the product picture scare you!
customer_reviews.text: First time I saw this mirror on Amazon, I ignored it because face in the mirror looked like Meatloaf's ugly love child. First impressions aside, this mirror is great! I have it in the bar end of my commuter bike (drop handlebars). The only time I need to adjust it is when I hit the mirror while locking up the bike. I have over 1000 miles with it and it is still solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a week.
customer_reviews.text: It fell apart after less than a week of riding. The rivet that holds the mirror in place got looser and looser and finally the mirror fell off from the base. I can't recommend this mirror at all. It's reviewed in mirror round ups as one of the worst ones out there... I could fix it by replacing the rivet with a screw but at this point i'm so annoyed with it I bought something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberdog

customer_reviews.title: Good product - easy to insall
customer_reviews.text: seems like a quality product that will keep you aware of cars that may be coming a little too close while you are on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have!
customer_reviews.text: Not the best but works very well and gives great coverage. I have one for both Bikes and never ride without one!
customer_reviews.author: Alastair W Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirrors to help keep you safe on the street.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, after having one on an older bicycle. I really like these mirrors. they are small enough to be unobtrusive, but still provide a very nice field of view. I would highly recommend these mirrors.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Great handlebar mirror
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a breeze, the hardest part was getting the plug out of my handlebar so I could insert the stem. Just turn it a couple times before you put it into the handlebar end so that it will grab, then just keep turning it until it's tight. It folds back against the handlebar so that it doesn't get in the way when bringing the bike through a doorway. Provides a good view of things and is highly adjustable. You really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Heather M. Baird

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: My first mirror (except for a helmet-mounted mirror that never worked right). Very easy & quick to install. Good quality image, easy to use. This is on a bike with straight bars; might not be as satisfactory on drop bars. Downsides are (1) an extra few inches of width to deal with when squeezing through narrow passages (2) it will probably not survive the first fall. But these things were obvious when I ordered it so I'm not disappointed. For commuting, there's definite safety value in a mirror and this is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: -Very simple to install. Step 1: Remove end cap from one side of the handlebars. Step 2: Insert mirror and twist until snug. -Folds and rotates easy enough to do it without looking away from the road. Gives a good field of view. -Feels like solid construction. Will probably last until I break it by my own fault. All together a good product. I would buy another of this brand (if and when I need to) and recommend it. In fact, I recommend a mirror in general for anyone who has to ride alongside traffic.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wide field of view
customer_reviews.text: I like the mirror, especially for $11. There's a WIDE field of view which is great when you are riding. I'm gonna take the advice of another reviewer and put loctite on the hinge screw so that doesn't fall off. It's been a good product.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: This is very helpful when pulling a bike trailer. I laid my bike over and broke it. This wasn't a fault in the design, just the user. So, be careful and only lay your bike down on the side opposite of the mirror if you must lay it down.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Lucas

customer_reviews.title: I can see the cars approaching
customer_reviews.text: This is the second "Third Eye Bicycle Mirror" I have purchased. I did not have any problem with the first one, but my bicycle was stolen along with the mirror. I am now riding my husbands bicycle and I hated riding without the mirror. I commute to work everyday and love being able to see cars approaching from the rear. Of course I still turn around to look if I plan on crossing into traffic. Love it, love it, love it.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: My problem with this mirror is it really isn't universal ...
customer_reviews.text: My problem with this mirror is it really isn't universal. It comes with a few adapters and they will either work or not work with your bike. In my case they did not work on either of our bikes. We have one brand new bike and one that is 15 years old. I might try the Mirrycle next just because it seems to be a much more universal for a fit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Mirrors !!!
customer_reviews.text: This bicycle mirror is perfect for our bikes, mountain bikes used on & off-road. Very easy to install, and don't forget to tighten the screw behind the mirror, so the mirror stays in position. It's easy to adjust as you're driving, or if it gets bumped around off-road. I've installed one on each side of the handle bars, and the views are clear, providing a wide view of traffic and terrain. They don't vibrate so the view is steady. They are the perfect solution for safer biking!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin H. Britton

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but needs frequent adjustment
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built mirror. The only problem is because it uses a rubber expansion joint to secure it in the handlebar, it has a memory effect. So if it gets knocked out of position, you have to rotate it back to where you want it, but then it slowly returns some of the way to the previous position, and you have to adjust it again a few times, until it finally settles down.
customer_reviews.author: H. Bustani

customer_reviews.title: well thought out design and made bicycle mirror
customer_reviews.text: This mirror was easy to install and can be taken off and put on easily. Great placement for field of vision and it is extremely stable so you don't have jitter. The convex lens is just right so you have a good field of vision without the image being to small and things appearing far away. I've tried helmet mirrors and various other mounted ones, this one is inexpensive and the best I've found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: It makes riding on the roads feel much safer, ...
customer_reviews.text: It makes riding on the roads feel much safer, but it does occasionally fall out of my handlebar. This usually happens if I've transported the bike by car and forgotten to remove it or if I've been riding on bumpy terrain. It's rare, but a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

product_meta.title: Third Eye Bar End Bicycle Mirror
product_meta.description: This mirror used to have a convex mirror. Currently it has a flat mirror.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
